item.title: Extremely dangerous intersection, 12th September
item.description:
This Extremely dangerous intersection must get reduced in size and humped, so that cars don't scare people to death any more. Please see my illustration.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Darenth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole 210cm long 30cm wide and 6cm deep, 12th September
item.description:
This pothole is directly between 2 lanes on the junction with bridge road and poses a hazard to motorcyclists turning left as it is directly in their path. This was reported previously but the council stated it did not meet their criteria. I have now measured it and can confirm that it poses an immediate risk to motorcyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus Stop F - Countdown unit not working, 11th September
item.description:
Bus stop F - Great Portland Street (Outside The Portland Hospital 205- 209 Great Portland Street). Despite several previous reports, the issue remains unresolved, and it’s causing considerable inconvenience to daily commuters who rely on accurate live bus information.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Euston Road, Fitzrovia, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Item, 11th September
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way at the junction with Market Place, Bexleyheath - opposite Bexleyheath Police Station: Please could you remove a dumped shopping trolley from the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road works hazard sign (A-frame type) abandoned on pavement outside 20 Craybrooke Road, 11th September
item.description:
A Road works hazard sign (A-frame type) has been left on the pavement outside 20 Craybrooke Road, Sidcup. It appears to have no identity on it in terms of who owns it. It appearsto be in good condition. It has been abandoned for over a week. Please could you remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Craybrooke Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sydenham Hill SE26 at the junction of Crystal Pala, 11th September
item.description:
Sydenham Hill SE26 at the junction of Crystal Palace Parade / Westwood Hill is a central island – curb stones are loose in the actual highway. See picture and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4262406,-0.073951,3a,41.2y,16.83h,81.08t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sEnpg_eBvTj0ClZ0sAkLmyQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D8.91649982247884%26panoid%3DEnpg_eBvTj0ClZ0sAkLmyQ%26yaw%3D16.832446157225604!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkwOC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
